FuncDef:
The mka timer sak-life command configures the Secure Association Key (SAK) lifetime of the key server.
The undo mka timer sak-life command deletes the SAK lifetime of the key server.
By default, no SAK lifetime is configured for the key server. To be specific, SAK switching is not implemented periodically.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a SAK lifetime.
The value is an integer that ranges from 300 to 604800, in seconds.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
When MACsec is used for secure communication, the SAK is used to encrypt and decrypt data packets. To ensure the security of data packets, if the number of packets encrypted using one SAK exceeds a certain value or one SAK is used for a certain period of time, replace the SAK.
Precautions
This command applies only to the key server.
